Reviews.Content: You can do better than this. We used this hotel for it's park, sleep and fly program. But we won't be back. The parking lot was a disaster - 24 hours after the snowfall they still hadn't cleared even a walking path to the front door. Getting into their parking lot, on a hill, required 4-wheel drive. The rooms were just OK but an up-grade is needed. Service was very poor - when we returned from our flight we had to phone three times for pick-up. The 5 minute ride from the terminal to the hotel took us 45 minutes, most of that, standing in the cold waiting for the beat-up van.
Reviews.Author: gmt44

Reviews.Content: Roach Motel Oh man, I agree with most of the people below this review. This hotel is falling down around it's occupants. Had we not gotten to the place so late, we definitely would have gone elsewhere. This place should be condemned. We kept our shoes on the whole time and did not let our baby off of the bed. They told us they had a crib, but when then brought it down, it was broken on one side and the plastic covering was half way torn off of the pad, if you could even call it that. I wouldn't dare put my child in it, so he had to sleep with us. They failed to give us the wake up call we requested, their courtesy number didn't work from the airport, the place was horribly dirty. Should I go on? The place is so outdated it has baseboard heating and reeks of mildew. My husband went down the hall to find an entire hallway with insulation falling out of the ceiling and buckets of materials strewn through the hallway. OHH..and yes there were still people staying in that hall! I would venture to guess this is a place where tricks are turned. DO not trust the pictures shown of this hotel, when we pulled up, my jaw dropped. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: mccuja1

Reviews.Content: Worst hotel stay ever! We stayed here the night before flying out for a cruise . It was a terrible place,and we would have gone elsewhere, but thought we would put up with it as we had to leave by 4 30 am for the airport. The place was filthy and floor felt sticky. There were 3 of us booked in a 2 room suite , with only 2 towels provided!!There was no hot water for a shower in the morning , water was cold at 4 am !! Bed was very uncomfortable . The place was cheap (we thought)at 119.00 for a 2 room suite , but after all the taxes added , it was rediculous what we were charged for such a terrible place . We would NEVER syat here again , and would advise everyone to stay away.
Reviews.Author: kenjana

Reviews.Content: Good with rates  Let's start from the top....Checking in was a less than desirerable experience. I was picked up at the airport by a shuttle and when we got to the hotel I was dropped off at the furthest point from the actual front desk. I was offered help with my bags but I refused thinking that the desk was very close  after that I got a room keys  I was very impressed with the size and quality of the bathroom and the fact that I was on the 3rd floor. Although not much of a height , but ys surrounding view was wonderful Front desk were very helpful in getting taxis and information on where to go for a decent time in the evening. I noticed that the housekeeping staff was also very nice and well behaved with everyone. My room was cleaned when i came back after 8 hours a day. As I opened the door I was happy to see my laptop still staring me in the face so I assumed nothing else was missing. Location is great....near to the seatac airport. I caught my flight own time, because after 6-7 mins. drive. I was on airport with comfortably by shuttle Eating places was also good surrounding areas it was not very expensive too. I do recommend for shopping to ...South Center mall approchable, not far away it takes 10-12 mins only. Variety of resturants and its look like a central attraction too.If get a chance again +vely i'll go with same hotel because easy in every part. About rates, facilities , approachable etc..
Reviews.Author: Enbody_Rose

Reviews.Content: Where cockroaches come to die! This hotel is a disgrace. Our room was old, moldy and had dead cockroaches in the bathroom. There was no clock radio. The bathroom did not look like it had been cleaned and there was huge chips missing out of the sink. The drywall was all patchy. We did not get the room we reserved and the bedding looked like it was 20 years old and there was no bedding on the sofa couch. I would not recommend anybody stay here especially for the rate they charge. It is on a steep hill and difficult to get around in. Stay far, far away from this place.
Reviews.Author: laberge8

Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place (they over charge) The place was okay, seemed clean and large rooms with eveything, but it was tired and needs repairs. The front desk is 1 person who is overwhelmed. Even with a confirmation number she could not find our reservation. She also had limited english, very challengingWe parked here and took the shuttle to the airport. 11 days later we returned, Car was fine and the shuttel worked out well both ways.We felt it was unusual that they took all our payments information when we arrived July 28, and then they took them again on our return August 9.Upon arriving home, 1 week later we learnt why they did this,.. Instead of the charge agreed for all, they put the same charge through twice. July 28 and again August 9. We contacted the hotel and followed their directs to get this corrected. So far, we have called them every week at least once if not 3 times to get this sorted out. All we have heard for the past 7 weeks are excuses and claims that their written accounts do not show the double payment and apparently they do not think the VISA bill may be more acrrate. Now just when they say they wil fix it cause they agree to the mistake, they up and loose our paper work so won't be doing. Tis is followed by another excuse about time and too much paperwork. I demanded this be fuixed with 48 hours. And I was hung up on by the manager.I now see that others have claimed similar stories about poor service and billing problems. BBB has a file on them. The manager lacks customer service and appears to not care about fixing their mistakes, or is intentionally keeping the moeny. Unclear which is correct. Perhaps both. Recommendation. go somewhere else.It is convenient, and the other employees do try, but this place is not worth the trouble....headaches nor money! Stay away. We are now asking VISA to correct this overcharge. So far they are far more accomodating.
Reviews.Author: tiredthree

Reviews.Content: It was cheap... but that was it. Their website looked decent and we were lured in by their cheap park 'n fly rates. We forgot our confirmation number at home which caused some confusion at the front desk. Once it was cleared up, they arranged for a shuttle to take us to SeaTac. Our car parked in their lot for a total of 5 days and there was no damage or stolen items from it as had happened with some of the other reviewers.One friend had an earlier flight back to Seattle than the rest of us so she went ahead and checked in first. According to her, there was a strand of hair found in the bathtub that was definitely not her own and at one point when she was lying spread out on the bed, resting from her flight in, the door to the room suddenly opened and one of the male staff walked into the room. Needless to say, she was shocked and told the man calmly that our room was already occupied. Apparently the man had problems with english and somehow managed to relay that he was there to check the smoke alarm. The door was quickly locked and bolted once he was done.This hotel is also apparently in a seedy area of Seattle. There is a subway about a 3 block walk down a fairly busy road and when she walked there later on in the day to grab some lunch numerous cars drove past honking their horns at her and some men even yelled out lewd comments as they drove past. Dressed in jeans and a hoody my friend was made to feel like a hooker and ended up staying in the hotel (motel??)for the rest of the day until our flight arrived later on that night.The 'non-smoking' room reaked of stale smoke. We opened the window to air the room out a bit, but there were no screens and we were at ground level so did not feel safe leaving it open during the night. The room itself was very spacious though. It had 3 double size beds as well as a couch pull-out, a kitchen with microwave and full sized fridge and stove, and a small eating area. The bathroom was really small in comparison, and the toilet was crooked and not quite leveled. Shower pressure was on the light side and there weren't enough towels to use despite us telling them that there were going to be 5 of us there.There was a free continental breakfast provided. I didn't go down because I happened to be the last of 5 to use the bathroom in the morning so I didn't see what the conditions were. My friends brought me up some toast with peanut butter and a cup of apple juice. After reading the other reviews here, I'm just glad I was able to eat my breakfast in ignorant bliss.Overall experience, I'd hate to say this is the worst establishment I've ever stayed in, but it would be very close. It was a one night stay and I don't think we would've stayed another night if we had to. The rates were cheap and would be great for those on a budget, but I'd definitely splurge more for a more restful night at another hotel the next time I'm in the area.
Reviews.Author: En_000

Reviews.Content: filthy and a broken shower There are no screens on the windows. The kitchen and bathroom floors were so dirty and sticky, I would not let my children take their shoes off. The coffee pot was filthy. AND...the water in the shower did not work! The beds had flat sheets on them instead of fitted sheets, so they didn't stay put. We didn't dare try the breakfast. This place is disgusting. Never again.
Reviews.Author: amomfromportland

Reviews.Content: Good Price and Large rooms with kitchen This is great hotel for large family since the rooms are huge with kitchen. We were family of five and the room was large enough to fit us all. The rooms do not have all the dishes but the hotel delivered extra dishes for cooking when requested. The hotel is little old but clean and if you are on a budget it is a perfect hotel.
Reviews.Author: jschnider65

Reviews.Content: Never again! It was good we stayed only one night because we wouldn't have stayed longer. The rooms were O.K. but the kitchens were very outdated. There was lipstick on the glasses. Furthermore, the breakfast was minimal and the eating area very poorly maintained. We're not picky people, but when your environment is not clean, it's hard to eat. In addition, our car after being parked for five days was damaged which I understand is not the hotels fault, but at least they could have followed up with our concerns. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and feel the rating is exaggerated.
Reviews.Author: Mom03Van

Reviews.Content: Terrible - We refused to stay... We were scheduled to check-in on June 13, 2008. The place reeked of smoke, yet was a non-smoking hotel. The exterior doors were unlocked. The perimeter of the property was overgrown and the trash piled in back. YUCK! Our first suite still had food on the counter from the prior occupants. The bathroom was mildewy and the floor around the toilet looked ready to collapse. We refused that suite. Our second suite also had a nasty bathroom. The doors would not close properly, either. The windows were nasty. In the lobby, the coffee maker area showed build-up of spills. The hallways had food crumbs and trash strewn about. The property needed a thorough cleaning and painting, inside and out. It appeared the management/owners did not care much for their property. This was not a place we felt comfortable staying! We refused to stay the night and made reservations at another hotel nearby.
Reviews.Author: All50in15

Reviews.Content: Death Trap!!!! Do not stay here. I booked this place using Expedia because of the price and location. However, I didn't realize that the rooms are more like a run down crack house in the worst of all neighborhoods. The walls had scuff marks, the paint was cracking, the halls and room reeked of smoke even though it was marketed as a non smoking floor. The Koreans three doors down were having a huge party, the family upstairs were running back and forth, the bathroom door had a huge hole poorly patched up, the internet was in and out, there was trash all over the grounds and the night attendee was very hostile. We called Expedia because the night manager Mohammed would not return our money and said this was their best room and we were moving to another place because we were visiting friends. A. This was my first time in Seattle B. He used my own cell phone to perpetrate the lie and C. He was very physically assertive. Expedia is graciously giving us a refund and taking this matter further with the owner. Also please note that this location is being used as a single room occupancy (SRO) for those on welfare and addicted to drugs. To the reader who had a similar experience and wrote about going to the Clarion at 176th and International Blvd. Thank you! We did that and for seven dollars more we stayed at four star hotel.I must reiterate do no stay here regardless if you are low on cash, have a pet, or want a good night's rest. You will be dead in the morning.
Reviews.Author: AlbertLA

Reviews.Content: strange short and curlies The hotel had the best deal for park and fly,and the staff was very friendly, but the rooms are starting to show their age. The shuttle service to and from the airport was prompt. However ,at both ends of our trip the bathrooms had not been cleaned properly. We don't need to stay in the lap of luxury if a hotel is convenient and a good deal, but I draw the line at showering with the last occupants short and curlies!. The toilet had a neat paper band across the seat, but it was obvious that not much more had been done to clean. I did mention this to the desk staffperson as we left, so perhaps they will find more attentive housekeeping staff.
Reviews.Author: bcrn

Reviews.Content: Health Violation! We usually stay at the Red Roofs Inn when travelling out of Seatac but decided to try Sutton Suites because of the complimentary breakfast - what a mistake. Our room was not ready upon arrival and we had to wait while the maintenance crew finished. We could hear every word from the suite next to ours. The bed were comfortable but the most appalling thing was the breakfast. You accessed the room from outside of the hotel. This door was not locked so anybody could have walked in. Breakfast consisted of bread for toast. Open jars of jam  peanut butter sat on a table with knives laid on top for communal use. Jugs of juice and milk were sitting open and unrefridgerated in a tupperware tray. Waffle batter was sitting in an open container, unrefridgerated and spilled all over the carpet and walls. It was gross and am sure if the health department saw the conditions would shut it down. YUCK!
Reviews.Author: teabag29

Reviews.Content: great rooms and friendly staff We used the park and fly for our two week trip. Had 2 rooms befor and after as 8 of us. Loved the rooms, very large and clean. Shuttle to airport very fast. Friendly staff. Breakfast free and you got make your own waffles, toast, cereal, juice coffee etc. The only downside was our vehicle was broken into. Little to steal but punched out driver side lock. Stole juice and candy but left MP3 player. If you do not have a vehicle to worry about it is a great place.
Reviews.Author: chichimama

Reviews.Content: Great value, Spacious, Car Parking, Shuttle to SEA Stayed 3 separate nights in the Non-Smoker area. Old building, but found all 3 rooms I have stated in to be spacious, beds comfortable, rooms clean, and had space for local friends/family to stop by chat and have coffee/tea/snack in the suite rooms that are about 2 times the size of a typical motel room. Parked a car for a 2 week time, all OK! Dependable Shuttle Bus to/from SEA. Easy to find, but away from the noise of the main SEA streets.50% of people I met in the Lobby were not US born, including the hotel owner. Each stay I have enjoyed talking with people from at least 4 different countries. Subway sanwiches one block away. Mini food mart 3 blocks away. Staff were helpful and friendly.
Reviews.Author: paharborview

Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet - good value Great value for money. Paid for a basic room - had a really nice suite - not sure if this is the norm. Staff really helpful. No elevators/lifts so this might prove a problem for the less mobile. Parking can be a bit tight but the staff will help out if req. Stayed here as last stop before returning the rental car and flying out in the morning for which this is an ideal very quite location. Highly recommended - think we paid about $70 for one night. Used the hotel self service laundary facilites - clean and in good working order.
Reviews.Author: moo_mikey

Reviews.Content: needs renovation. feels unsafe. Office staff rude  denied having our reservation... showed confirmation  suddenly, there was our reservation! Afterwards, really wished we didn't stay here. We found this place through Southwest Airlines website link. Food caked on silverware, dishes dirty, room rundown... entire place in dire need of renovation. Odor of foreign cooking permeates the building. Difficult to find parking in FULL lot. Felt uncomfortable  felt unwelcomed. People up  about, in  out all hours of night/morning. Mid-eastern men in turbans prevalent all over the grounds, glaring  non-communicative.
Reviews.Author: DonnaLMT

Reviews.Content: Run down Building and bad experience Our family stayed there at the begining of our vacation. So we parked our car there for seven days when we were in Hawaii. When we came back from Hawaii , we found that our car was damaged by a hit and run. We phoned back and talked to the manager. She said that the camera was broken and did not know who hit our car. Breakfast is only bread. The bathroom had moss on the floor and around the bathtub. The entry door door did not work and opened 24/7.
Reviews.Author: Dragon4980

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! When I showed up at the Hotel at 10:00 p.m. to check-in, theysaid they over booked and did not have a room for me. The frontdesk person did not speak very good english and was very rude!He tole me I could stay at the Days Inn I guess he has a dealwith them if he over books they will pick up the slack. When I got to the Days Inn the front desk guy was very nice about theincident. I had prepaid for my room at the Sutton Suites whichI paid for a King bed non-smoking. The Dyas Inn only had aQueen bed in smoking. The room smelled so bad of smoke.The Sutton Suites were not willing to give me back the price difference of the rooms either. What a frustrating experience!
Reviews.Author: kat1222

Reviews.Content: Surprisingly Nice After seeing numerous bad reviews for this hotel I was a little apprehensive to stay here but was lured in by the cheap rates and kitchen. However the room proved to be a gem. The room was HUGE, especially for the price including a kitchen, bed area, sitting area and small dining space for only $75. The kitchen was well supplied for a hotel kitchen and I had no problem making a full dinner here. Overall, it was clean and all of the furniture seemed well kept-up. My only complaint is the bed was sunkdown a little in the middle. Despite that, I would stay here again if I was in need of a kitchen suite.
Reviews.Author: roamingwildly

Reviews.Content: Rooms are large, but GM is HORRID! The rooms are rather clean and are equiped with an entire kitchen, dishes, pots and pans. The cleaning staff will make accomodations for you so don't worry about dish soap, tin foil, etc, HOWEVER, the General Manager lacks communication and resolution skills. The hotel put a $300 hold on our credit card and forgot to take it off. We asked the GM to release our money and she refused to believe the hotel had done such a thing. Our bank had to phone her and she suddenly found a $300 processing fee, after much debate. We confirmed through her other employees that guests have made complaints. Would not do business with this woman. She works from 5 AM - 3 PM. Avoid!
Reviews.Author: nowim23

Reviews.Content: Big Rooms  I traveled with my wife and kids and stayed in one Room. The room was big to accommodate the whole family. The complete kitchen made our one week trip very inexpensive and fun. The rooms were clean and spacious. I would recomend this to any family traveling on a budget. Thanks sutton suites
Reviews.Author: CRAIGHERISH

Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price We stayed at the Sutton suites hotel for three days. The rooms were very spacious with two Queen beds, dining table, kitchen and sofa. The rooms are little bit old but very clean. The hotel was great for the price we paid.
Reviews.Author: p2carlsbad

Reviews.Content: Don't be Fooled! Go Somewhere Else Chose this hotel for the park and fly package. Looked clean and reasonable from the photos posted on their web page. However, the room we were assigned to was in the basement in the back of the hotel. We parked closest to the entrance under the light but still our car was broken into when we came back from our trip 5 days later. No surveillance cameras, no monitoring. Management just laughed about it. Save yourself the trouble, go somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: aldofrombrazil

Reviews.Content: terrible My husband and I stayed one night and might have well just slept in the airport and it would have been more comfortable. The beds seemed to us to be between 30 to 50 years old, sheets were to small for mattress and there was no mattress pad it was gross, so you were directly touching the old mattress. Every one on the shuttle bus to the airport was disgusted in the place ( we all discussed it) had it not been snowing and all hotels were booked we would have left. I can not believe it gets a 3 star , it is a 1 star at the most. Never again ! The place was old and dirty. P.S. they even left us off at the wrong terminal .
Reviews.Author: qrackers

Reviews.Content: Probably wouldn't return ... Well, this was our first (and likely, last) stay at Sutton Suites. We typically stay at the Red Lion Seatac airport as they also have park and fly rates to leave your car parked while on vacation. After staying at Sutton Suites I would recommend ponying up the extra $40-50 to stay at Red Lion in luxury. Sutton Suites is a converted apartment building and it is in bad need of a full remodel or tear it down and rebuild altoghether. Rooms did not seem clean and it was a bit scary to take a shower in that bathtub/shower . We had two queen beds in the room and the one bed had an electrical outlet at pillow level that had the plugs for the lamp and clock radio (didn't sleep well thinking the plugs would get bumped and knocked out and we'd miss our early AM flight). We could hear folks walking above us all night long too. The furniture in the room was so old, dingy and rickety and the bed rocked around with the slightest move. One good note - the hotel shuttle was fine - took us where we needed to go when we needed to go and picked us up right away when we arrived back at Seatac. The shuttle driver was also very friendly, which made up for the somewhat unfriendly front desk clerk. There isn't a restaurant on the property or anywhere within walking distance either. Again, likely wouldn't return to Sutton Suites.
Reviews.Author: M&D1970

Reviews.Content: Convenient location, courteous service My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Suites overnight during the Easter long weekend. We found the employees to be very polite and accomodating. This spot is minutes away from SeaTac, and their shuttle service was very punctual.Our room was very spacious  quiet, with a full-sized fridge and stove which was really convenient.My only objection was one or two sizable potholes in the parking lot -- along as you avoid those if you're driving, you're fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disgraceful customer service We had the misfortune of staying at this hotel while in transit from Seatac to our home in Canada.Having read previous reviews we thought it would be an ideal spot to leave our vehichle and take a quick 5 hour sleep after our flight home.BIG MISTAKE!Not only did they lose our car key,which obviously was not kept in a secure place,but then had the audacity to say that they were not legally responsible for the safe keeping of our vehicle key.One can certainly understand if a vehichle has been broken into, however when the estalbishment is negligent by losing a key...that is another story.The Manager of the hotel was rude and condescending to say the least.Other than paying for the replacement of the key,she refused to acknowlege their mistake.We were charged for the full rate of the room and the full rate of parking, although we lost a full day in work(it took over 6 hours to have the key replaced) and had to pay for the re-coding of our spare key which was at home.BEWARE!After you drop off your car at this establishment they feel that they are not legally responsible for the vehichle or the keys that you entrust them with.Mr.and Mrs PaksaVancouver,Canadaapaksa@yahoo.com
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not our first choice We stayed here for one night as a park-sleep/fly customer only because no other hotels had a vacancy. I couldn't have stayed more than the few hours we did. When we first checked in around 5pm and opened the door to the room, the room was so heavily scented with air freshener we could hardly breathe. Made us wonder what was being covered up. The location is good only for the proximity to the airport. Van service was on time with just a short wait. Parking was definitely scarce. Would have to be pretty desperate to stay there again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Yuck Not the worst, but close. I think in this place it really depends on which building you stay in. We were in the main building  they have people who actually live there. It was very run down, not filthy, but not clean either. The smells from all of the cooking were pretty bad. Old grease  such. The service was excellent. If you needed or asked for something, it was taken care of immediately. What this place is really needing is a renovation. It's just really run down  the smells are pretty bad. We stayed 3 nights. I probably wouldn't stay again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved Sutton Suites I stayed at Sutton suites for 5 days with my children. The service was great, rooms were huge with two beds, sleeper sofa, TV, dining area and full kitchen. I also used the free shuttle to go to local restaurants, the mall and Safeway.The breakfast was minimal with cereals, juices and toast. I noticed lot people that were staying at hotel were going on Cruise and they had shuttle dropping them off at cruiseship.Overall the hotel was great for the price I paid. I found cheaper rates by directly going to Suttonsuites website.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Old apt. house converted, smelly  We made reservations on line, arrived at the location which is an old apartment house converted into a motel. Neither personnel at the reception spoke understandable English. The insisted on a enrollment form even though all of the information had been furnished on line. The room with kitchenette smelled, was dirty. My husband told them the room was unacceptable and requested a refund, which was initially refused. After a brief discussion he did receive the cancellation. There are many other quality accomodations in the greater area, i.e. Marriott Town Place Suites at the same price and only a couple of miles from SeaTac.
Reviews.Author: laarrowhd

Reviews.Content: Loved SuttonSuites. Great Staff I was traveling on business trip to Seattle and found the hotel to be clean and very comfortable. Free wireless connection was great. I used the free shuttle a lot to go to local businesses. This hotel would be great for family or business traveler on a long trip.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great place for parksleepfly clean and close to airport i like the size of suites.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good location if on a Limited budget. Not a Holiday Inn, but a step up from a Motel 6. If on a limited budget this is a good hotel to stay. Except for a young women with an Arabic accent at the front counter during check-in, I found all other staff very courteous and most willing to go out of their way to be of service. However, the young women to whom I refer does appear to be in need of customer greeting and assistance training. The shuttle to and from the airport required very little wait. Just a reminder to those using this service, please remember to tip the shuttle driver. I saw this young man loading and unloading luggage and not receiving a tip from most and I personally saw this as an insult. A suggestion to management, the rooms I stayed in should have the lamp shades and curtains replaced. I'm certain that it would be good for business to have maintenance check the rooms for the little things.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Sutton suites is worth a try  I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. I called the hotel from the airport and they were ther in less then 10 minutes. There are not a lot of places to eat in that area so i walked to safeway, that took 8 minutes, and cooked myself. The breakfast the served is just cereal, toast and juice. I think they should add fresh fruit and bagals to the menu. The staff was nice to me and helpful. Iwould stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beware parking costs Parking costs are higher than expected because they maximise the number of days by using the noon to noon hotel day, not 24 days. They will not negotiate when told this is unfair. Accommodation OK. Good drop-off and pick-up. Continental breakfast needs a healthier choice of bread. We will look elsewhere next time at SeaTac.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very poor service. Do not stay here. We stayed here using their park and fly deal. Be aware that the night of your stay at the hotel is included in the 7 days of parking they allow. I got into an argument with the owner when he tried to charge us for extra days of parking. He began yelling at me in the lobby and grabbed my arm. The room we stayed in was clean but VERY sparse. The pillows were horrible and there was not even an alarm clock in the room. The continental breakfast was a disgusting joke. I would not recommend that anyone stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You can do better   showReview(1742407, 'full');
Reviews.Author: PdxJulie

Reviews.Content: Just so-so   showReview(1741788, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Incredibly RUDE 'Manager'   showReview(1733197, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I keep coming back   showReview(1386595, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: grim little dungeon   showReview(1346448, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stayed one night   showReview(1231284, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Adequate, reasonable.   showReview(1132437, 'full');
Reviews.Author: victoriabcguy

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel shuttle service   showReview(1129731, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Outstanding service at Sutton Suites   showReview(692974, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
